title: Pitch Output
description: Structured output from the pitch skill. Contains a complete go-to-market launch kit: landing page copy, launch posts, GitHub product README, email sequence, launch checklist, A/B test spec, and kill criteria -- all grounded in offer-scope positioning, persona data, and SWOT findings.

pitch_id.description: Unique identifier for this pitch, e.g. 'pitch-devops-decision-kit-2026-02-08'

domain.description: The domain this pitch targets (e.g. 'DevOps education', 'cybersecurity careers')

opportunity.description: The specific opportunity from the signal scan this pitch addresses

product_name.description: The name of the product being pitched

landing_page.description: Complete landing page copy, ready to paste into any landing page builder

headline.description: The main headline -- must stop the scroll, uses persona's exact pain language

subheadline.description: States the transformation in concrete terms: what they get, what changes, how fast

above_the_fold_hook.description: First 2-3 sentences below the headline. Acknowledges pain, promises outcome, creates curiosity.

problem_section.description: Full copy for the problem section. Uses persona's exact language, references minimum 3 pain stories.

solution_section.description: Full copy for the solution section. Transformation, how it works, speed, effort required.

whats_inside.description: Section-by-section breakdown from the offer-scope build spec

section_name.description: The section name from the build spec

description.description: Benefit-oriented description of what this section does for the buyer

social_proof_strategy.description: Strategy for zero-testimonial launch: credentials proof, process proof, methodology proof

pricing_section.description: Full pricing copy including price anchor, value stack, the price, guarantee, and urgency element if applicable

faq.description: FAQ items built from persona objections. Each Q maps to a specific objection.

question.description: The persona objection reframed as a question the buyer would actually ask

answer.description: The counter from offer-scope objection handlers, expanded into conversational copy

primary_cta.description: Primary call to action -- button text and surrounding copy. Specific, not generic.

secondary_cta.description: Secondary call to action -- lower-commitment action (email signup, free preview, GitHub repo)

launch_posts.description: Platform-specific launch posts, ready to publish. Each follows 80/20 value-first rule.

title.description: Post title or hook. Platform-appropriate format.

body.description: Full post body. Provides genuine standalone value. Ready to publish.

cta.description: Call to action at the end of the post. Natural transition from value to product.

formatting_notes.description: Platform-specific formatting guidance (markdown style, paragraph length, hashtags, thread pacing)

github_readme.description: GitHub product README combining product structure with conversion-optimized copy

product_structure.description: Product architecture for the GitHub repo. ACTIVATES for technical domains (DevOps, security, coding, architecture, STEM).

directory_layout.description: The actual directory tree for the repo, formatted as a text tree

description.description: One-line description of what the file contains and why it matters

learning_path.description: How someone progresses through the repo

description.description: What the user does in this step and what they learn

prerequisites.description: What the user needs to know before using this repo

readme_content.description: The full README.md content. Includes hero section, product structure preview, decision framework preview (the free 80%), CTA sections, social proof, contributing, and license.

landing_page_html.description: Metadata about the generated landing page HTML file. The actual HTML is written to the launchpad branch, not embedded in the JSON output.

file_path.description: Path to index.html on the launchpad branch (always 'index.html' at branch root)

vercel_preview_url.description: The Vercel branch preview URL where the page is live

sections_rendered.description: List of Phase 1 sections that were rendered into HTML

has_hero_image.description: Whether og:image and twitter:image meta tags reference an actual hero.png

file_size_bytes.description: Size of the generated index.html in bytes. Should be under 30720 (30KB).

email_sequence.description: Post-purchase email nurture sequence. 3-5 emails building trust from delivery to community.

subject_line.description: Specific subject line. Must pass the A-pile test -- looks like a message from a person, not a brand.

send_day.description: Day to send relative to purchase (0 = immediately, 2 = day 2, etc.)

purpose.description: The ONE job of this email (deliver, quick win, story, objection handler, community invite)

body.description: Full email body copy. Practitioner-to-practitioner tone. Single CTA.

launch_checklist.description: Step-by-step execution sequence with specific dates, times, and platforms

tool_needed.description: Specific tool required (Gumroad, ConvertKit, GitHub, Carrd, etc.)

estimated_time.description: How long this takes (e.g. '30 minutes', '2 hours')

week_1.description: Daily actions for the first week after launch

actions.description: List of specific actions for this day

ongoing_cadence.description: Ongoing distribution cadence for weeks 2-4 and beyond

ab_test_spec.description: What to test once distribution is flowing. Designed for solo operators with 100-500 visitors.

headline_variants.description: 2-3 headline alternatives with rationale for each

rationale.description: Why this variant might work (pain-focused, outcome-focused, curiosity-focused, etc.)
Positioning at this price, what it signals, SPEND data support
Why this channel is prioritized at this position

test_budget.description: Time and/or money to allocate to testing this channel

metrics.description: Metrics to track with targets and measurement methods

metric.description: What to measure (e.g. 'landing page conversion rate', 'email signup rate')

measurement_method.description: Specific tool or method (e.g. 'Gumroad analytics', 'UTM parameters in Google Analytics')

decision_thresholds.description: At what point to declare a winner or take action

threshold.description: At what value to act (e.g. '2x difference over 200+ visitors')

action.description: What to do when the threshold is hit (e.g. 'switch to winning variant permanently')

kill_criteria.description: Time-bounded, measurable criteria for iterate/pivot/kill decisions

metric.description: What to measure (e.g. 'units sold', 'launch post engagement')

threshold.description: Minimum acceptable number (e.g. '5 units sold', '50+ upvotes on launch post')

metric.description: Growth trajectory measure (e.g. 'month-over-month growth rate', 'organic traffic trend')

qualitative_signals.description: Non-numeric signals that indicate viability or failure

pivot_triggers.description: Specific conditions that trigger a strategy change vs full kill

trigger.description: The specific condition (e.g. 'people engage with free content but do not convert')

pivot_direction.description: What changes (e.g. 'reduce price by 30%', 'switch to video format', 'target different subreddit')

offer_ref.description: Reference to the offer-scope output file used as input

persona_ref.description: Reference to the persona-extract output file used as input

swot_ref.description: Reference to the SWOT analysis output file used as input

decision_ref.description: Reference to the decision-log output file used as input

signal_scan_ref.description: Reference to the signal-scan output file used as input

next_step.description: The next skill in the pipeline. Always 'hunter-log' for pitch output.
